intro: Mackenziea sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mackenziea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sessile leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Mackenziea sessilis is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
